article.headline: St. Bonaventure 58, Albany, N.Y. 54
article.story: OLEAN, N.Y. (AP) -- Michael Lee scored a game-high 20 points to lead St. Bonaventure over Albany, 58-54 Saturday. DLancy Carter had a season-high 15 rebounds and scored eight points for the Bonnies (5-5). Zarryon Fereti added 12 points. For the Great Danes (4-4), Jon Iati scored a team-high 12 points on 4-of-8 3-point shooting. Brian Lillis and Brent Wilson had 10 points apiece. Lillis added seven assists. After trailing by six at the half, Albany began the second half with a 19-4 run to take a 51-41 lead. The Bonnies responded with a 15-0 run to regain the lead with 2:37 to play and would not give it up. Albany scored just three points in the games final seven minutes and did not shoot one free throw in the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
